TextView.android:text: 1 Word Ending -ily The word ending -ily is represented by a narrow loop.
• Observe the special joining of s in families. This joining helps form an outline that is easily read.
2 Word Beginning Al- The word beginning al- is represented by the shorthand letter o.
3 Word Beginning Dis, Des- The word beginnings dis-, des- represented by d-s.

An expression in apposition (that is, a word or a phrase or a clause that identifies or explains another word or term) should be set off by commas. When the expression in apposition occurs at the end of a sentence, only one comma is necessary.

My employer, Ms. Mildred H. O’Brien, is out of town. The book, Human Relations, is now for sale. The meeting is scheduled for Wednesday, June 23. Each time an expression in apposition appears in the Reading and Writing Practice, it will be indicated thus in the shorthand.
